name: Congenital Left Ventricular Diverticulum with Arrhythmogenic Substrate
chief_complaint: My child keeps fainting during play and complains of chest pain
physical_findings: systolic murmur (grade II/VI) at left lower sternal border
prognosis: Guarded - high risk for sudden cardiac death without intervention, but good quality of life possible with proper management
description: A rare congenital cardiac anomaly where a finger-like protrusion of the left ventricular myocardium creates an arrhythmogenic focus. The diverticulum acts as an anatomical substrate for re-entrant ventricular arrhythmias, particularly during periods of increased sympathetic tone. Often misdiagnosed as benign PVCs until syncopal events occur.
risk_factors: family history of sudden cardiac death
